title: Block Your Number on a Samsung Galaxy Phone: Call & Text

steps.title: Open the Phone app.
steps.content: Open the Phone app. It’s the green icon with a white phone receiver. You’ll usually find it on the home screen.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . The "More" menu has three dots in a vertical line. You'll see it at the top-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . This will expand the settings for the Phone app.

steps.title: Tap Supplementary services.
steps.content: Tap Supplementary services . You might need to scroll down the Settings menu to find it. This menu can be "More Settings" instead.

steps.title: Tap Show your caller ID.
steps.content: Tap Show your caller ID . You'll see the current setting in green text below this menu header. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Never.
steps.content: Tap Never . Now your caller ID won't display to others when you call them. If you have a second SIM card in your phone, you can also hide your caller ID for that phone number using the "Show your caller ID" under the "SIM card 2" header. You can also use *67 to make a call private . Dialing this code is temporary, so your next call will show your caller ID unless you dial *67 again. If you don't have a Samsung Galaxy, you can still hide your number. This wikiHow article shows you how!
